name: explosively
content:
explosively adverb
(BURST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to, causes, or is caused by something exploding: The substance is toxic and explosively flammable.
in a way that is very sudden and powerful, like an explosion: During our conversation he sometimes giggles explosively. As a player he was talented and explosively energetic.
More examplesFewer examplesLiquid carbon dioxide seeped to the surface, where it would explosively vaporize and blast outward, like a small volcano.A-bombs require highly concentrated amounts of fissionable materials that are explosively compressed together.The volcano may erupt explosively.He coughed explosively.

explosively adverb
(GROWTH)
in a way that grows or spreads extremely quickly: India and China were enjoying explosively growing economies. These weeds cause problems because of their ability to spread explosively.
More examplesFewer examplesIn no other land or period in the history of the world has there been such an explosively expanding economy.The company has grown explosively to become the world's leading maker of medical devices.The company had an explosively successful initial public offering. The infection comes on explosively, just like bacterial meningitis.The disease moves explosively through herds of wild deer.
